intro: Stylidium dichotomum, commonly known as the two-branched sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its small, brightly colored flowers that resemble orchids. The plant produces a unique structure called a "stolón," which is a modified stem that helps in vegetative propagation. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
